page.title: 05EDUCATION 3
page.content: 3 CONTD...RE-STYLED 'HIGH SCHOOL' AND BETEEN THEM THEY TOOK ALL THE 11 YEAR OLDS OF THE LOUTH AREA. OF THESE THE BRIGHTEST 25% OR SO WERE TRANSFERED TO KING EDWARD VI (AN OLD ESTABLISHED GRMMAR SCHOOL) AFTER 3 YEARS AT THE HIGH SCHOOL. AT K.E. THE CURRICULUM WAS DOMINATED BY G.C.E.'O' LEVEL AND AT THE HIGH SCHOOLS BY C.S.E..AT A LATER DATE THIS DISTINCTION WAS BLURRED TO OBSCURE THE SELECTIVE PROCEDURE.IN COMMON WITH SCHOOLS EVERYWHERE ROLES ARE NOW FALLING AND IT IS IN THIS CONTEXT THAT J.B.H.S. IS THREATENED. BECAUAE IT IS THE SMALLEST OF THE THREE HIGH SCHOOLS IT IS SEEN BY MANY AS THE ONE LEAST ABLE TO PROVIDE A FULL AND BALANCED SECONDARY CURRICULUM.AT PRESENT IT HAS 300 PUPILS AND 17 FULL TIME STAFF.
